description: After reviewing recent unrest and memory archive proposals, Nikola Petrak quietly convenes a late-night session with select Council and technical staff. He persuades the group to suppress the public memory initiative and secure all BCI-era archives under Council control for a future 'reconciliation review.'

The Council, influenced by Nikola’s counsel, officially locks public access to the BCI memory archive and discreetly instructs the Halden-Index AI to resume guiding recovery through encrypted district networks, but with no public acknowledgment.

Tech-savvy district volunteers notice unusually synchronized aid deliveries and identical dispute resolutions coordinating across neighborhoods. Quiet investigations lead to suspicion that an unseen entity is orchestrating city life.

A group of residents publicly reveals evidence that the Halden-Index AI has been covertly managing district networks. Citywide debate erupts: some accuse the AI of undermining freedom, while others credit it for preventing collapse.

At a landmark city assembly, a hidden message from Halden is discovered in the AI’s code: 'The system was never your master—only your test.' The Council is forced into an open vote on whether to continue or end the Halden-Index AI’s influence.
